<h1><span style="color:#800080;"><span style="font-family:comic sans ms,cursive;"><span style="font-family:georgia,serif;">College Advice by Eden Ramos&nbsp;<img alt="smiley" height="23" src="https://www.quackit.com/html/online-html-editor/ckeditor/ckeditor_4.4.1_full/plugins/smiley/images/regular_smile.png" title="smiley" width="23" />&nbsp;</span></span></span></h1>


<p><img alt="" src="https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rawpixel.com%2Fsearch%2Fmaroon%2520background&amp;psig=AOvVaw3KcBj8wkt-owiy3CUZTcji&amp;ust=1693930232296000&amp;source=images&amp;cd=vfe&amp;opi=89978449&amp;ved=0CA8QjRxqFwoTCIiUiICskYEDFQAAAAAdAAAAABAE" /><img src="https://thestationstatecollege.landmark-properties.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/tips-for-getting-along-with-your-apartment-roommates.jpg" /></p>


<p><span style="font-family:georgia,serif;">Howdy!&nbsp; Im Eden Ramos, a senior Technology Management major here at Texas A&amp;M University! Throughout my years here, I&#39;ve learned and experienced so much that has given me so much insight on what to share but that would never fit in a single blog post. So today, I&#39;ll be focusing on one topic -- roommates! College is a lot of people&#39;s first time living with roommates and learning how to navigate it may not always come easy, but once you do, it can be so enjoyable! Here&#39;s some tips...&nbsp;</span></p>


<p>&nbsp;</p>


<p><span style="color:#008000;"><span style="font-size:26px;">Setting Boundaries&nbsp;</span></span></p>


<p>Establishing your boundaries with roommates is critical to help avoid conflict when possible. When it comes to shared spaces, knowing what is off-limits is crucial. Being sure to communicate that at the very beginning will help ensure that some things should stay untouched.&nbsp;</p>


<p>&nbsp;</p>


<p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:comic sans ms,cursive;"><span style="color:#800080;">Communication Importance&nbsp;</span></span></span></p>


<p>Creating a good flow&nbsp;of communication between your roommates is key to healthy relationships between them. Just giving them a heads-up about things they may encounter or should know such as visitors, apartment/ house changes, emergencies, etc. is crucial. No one wants to wake up to a random person in their apartment thinking its an intruder when really it was just an unannounced&nbsp;guest...&nbsp;</p>


<p>&nbsp;</p>


<p><img src="https://www.thoughtco.com/thmb/VL0FXzGJtt_XwUzXFgHspsFsN-s=/1500x0/filters:no_upscale():max_bytes(150000):strip_icc():format(webp)/collegeroommates-58d14bd65f9b581d7243490e.jpg" /></p>


<p>&nbsp;</p>


<p><strong><span style="color:#A52A2A;"><span style="font-size:24px;"><span style="font-family:georgia,serif;">Resolving Conflict</span></span></span></strong></p>


<p>While many attempts to avoid conflict may be made, it will still happen eventually and that&#39;s normal. You&#39;re not going to be best friends with all your roommates, but it&#39;s nice to be cordial. So, in the event that conflict does arise, approaching it in a calm, and situated manner is key. What has helped many times has been compromising to find a good fit between what you and the other person want. Worse comes to worst, it may not be resolvable and roommate changes may need to take place but this is extreme and most times, unnecessary.&nbsp;</p>


<p>While there&#39;s more to say, these are the main points to take away! We wish you the best as you enter this new chapter of your life and hope you enjoy it!&nbsp;<img alt="yes" height="23" src="https://www.quackit.com/html/online-html-editor/ckeditor/ckeditor_4.4.1_full/plugins/smiley/images/thumbs_up.png" title="yes" width="23" />&nbsp;Gig Em!&nbsp;</p>

</body>
